items.title: Slow Signs - Listening for Language with Positive Capability
items.description: It's taken me ten years to learn a little bit about slowing down. Now, I am just slow enough that I have the time and space to discuss this.

items.title: Animal's People - Embodying What You Read
items.description: A long essay on one of the most important novels ever written, exploring the limits of empathy, the failings of liberalism, and what it really means to read responsibly.

items.title: How To Language Large Language Models
items.description: What does a proper understanding of the limits and power of language imply about how we address LLMs?

items.title: Martyr of Hope - A Tribute to Bantu Steve Biko
items.description: My tribute to one of the true stalwarts of the struggle against apartheid in South Africa, one of the greatest intellects to ever grace the African continent.

items.title: The Final Belt
items.description: A true story about a Two Row Wampum Council meeting in which the Black Wampum Belt was shown for the first time in this Great Year.

items.title: Viewing Time
items.description: By drawing a clear distinction between reality, and what we know about reality, this essay makes an argument for how to think about, describe and experience time differently.

items.title: Blue Devotion
items.description: This essay summarises the ideas behind, and the work done to achieve, The Blue Book. What is this digital artifact really inspired by?

items.title: Living: The Essay
items.description: There is another reality, the genuine one, which we lose sight of. This other reality is always sending us hints which, without art, we can't receive.

items.title: Finding Blue Infinity
items.description: How to build your own book using an infinite library and non-fungible tokens that are responsible for what gets displayed.

items.title: A Beautiful Question
items.description: A deep and wide walk, led by Frank Wilczek, through the wonderful world of scientific symmetries and Quantum Chromo-Dynamics.

items.title: What is Privacy
items.description: A wanderer's view on an issue critical to our age

items.title: Governing Gracefully
items.description: Governance mechanisms that distribute funds by virtue of how they work will trump those that attempt to distribute funds as an outcome of their work.

items.title: Language In The Ether
items.description: What does it mean to have an expressive programming language, which compiles down to binary and runs on a shared world computer?

items.title: All The Colourful People
items.description: An essay which discusses colourful and grey people, and how to stand beside one another in such a way that we can help the other turn to face the light.

items.title: Reading As Layered Ritual
items.description: An exposition of Stanley Kunitz's famous poem, 'The Layers' which goes into the art of deciphering and the many layers of self and text.

items.title: Transformative Tools
items.description: A piece about memory and what it might mean to transform the very tools we use to learn and live.
